Body: Reading the documentation for IBM's "Internet of Things" managed host platform
column9:
I'm supposed to use MQTT as the protocol when connecting my devices to the cloud service.

How can I configure the service to ensure the data between my devices and the cloud is encrypted?

Do I need to configure security at the messaging or transport layers?

"

Body:
The IBM IoTF service will accept an encrypted client connection using TLS to secure the link. Connect to the service using port 8883 (or 443 for websockets) for a TLS-secured connection with a compatible client library.

Certificate file (messaging.pem) for the *.messaging.internetofthingscloud.ibmcloud.com chain is available here.

The IoT Foundation requires TLS v1.2.

"
